text:
"Changed my review from 4 star to 1 star.

Current: This is the worst shoprite ever. I mean I can't see it getting any worse.
Consistently jacking up the prices and extremely poor quality produce over the last few months.
Most items are marked up higher to the Jersey City. To top it - poor quality produce.
Consistently got stale oranges for e.g.
If I had a car
column5:
I would have never visited this place again.

Previous: Good quality.
Has a wide range of fresh grocery.
Wish they had a small section for Indian grocery like the one in Jersey City."

author: stella ng
text: 'The disrespect received from this store is absolutely unacceptable. To turn away people in need of a shelter during the hurricane about 2 weeks ago
column5: how much humanity left does the manager of this store have? Furthermore
column6: the people they turned away when they needed shelter
column7: one was someone who works in healthcare. They risked their lives saving people
column8: sacrificing their health and life for somebody else. What if one of the shop-rite workers had been in a life-threatening situation and had been turned away simply because the hospital is closed? You really couldn‚Äôt even open up the lobby space for helpless people to find shelter?\nThis situation really shows how much we can‚Äôt depend on each other.\nIf you have any morales
column9: please boycott this particular shop rite. Corporate needs to rethink management on this store.\nIn fact
column10: I don‚Äôt even trust what the corporate offices‚Äô policy are for each store
column11: but this reflect that a change in the policy is needed.\nShop rite
column12: you really let us down on this one.'

author: Yanira silva
text: 'Never again will I ordered for delivery . I never received my delivery. I waited from 5 to 930. I called the store all they can tell me is that the driver is out. No communication at all. Nobody called to tell me anything . At the end I had to cancel my order.. I had no food at home !! I had to get out of work early the next day to go shopping !! The worst thing is like no explanation from anyone'

author: Alvaro Rangel
text: 'Today was my first time and last time at this store. When I was checking out the cashier was taking her time as if there were not a bunch of people behind me in line. She looked like she could care less about her job. My grandma could literally probably scan items faster than her. Anyways that‚Äôs not the biggest problem
column5: the biggest problem was when I tried to ask her about water jug refills and she looked at me with so much disgust and annoyance. What a rude staff. I don‚Äôt know why people act this way. If they hate their job they should leave and go do something else. I hate this sort of entitlement from people. I hope management makes changes soon but will not be returning ever.'

author: Alice
text: 'If I could give this store -1 stars
column5: I would. The manager of the store was so unempathetic and selfish. During the Ida hurricane/flash flood that took lives in New Jersey
column6: a couple of people wanted to seek shelter to stay warm and dry. However
column8: she kicked everyone out and had the attitude of
column9: "you\'re on your own". What if something happened to those people because of her decision? She only thought about herself and the store and not the lives of the people morally. Understand that when store closes
column10: people who are not employees should leave. BUT THIS WAS AN EMERGENCY THAT WAS LIFE THREATENING. Aren\'t people supposed to help each other during an emergency? Be kind hearted? One person I know that experienced this is a pharmacist in a hospital and was stuck in the flood after getting off from work. HE HELPS SAVE LIVES. What does he get in return? SOMEONE TRYING TO KICK HIM OUT IN AN EMERGENCY. HIS CAR GOT SUBMERGED IN WATER. IT\'S GONE. I will never put my money on this shop rite because of the unethical treatment this manager gave. UNBELIEVEABLE.'

column6: you\'re forced to debate with customer service that feels you are not due either refund or exchange because of covid. I\'ve been told by the customer service rep on several occasions "we don\'t do refunds or exchanges on products once they leave the store because of covid."  So
column7: it\'s our fault your stores merchandise was rotten?!?  Tonight
column8: I had another freezer burnt haagen daz ice cream that I purchased this afternoon and ate it bc I know the pettiness I will face with their unprofessional rep is not worth the headache.  But then again

author: Brian Lowe
text: 'I went to this ShopRite to buy a birthday cake for my friend. When I arrived at the bakery department
column5: I picked out a cake and asked the woman behind the counter if I could get writing on the cake. She nastily told me that I had to go the front of the store
column6: pay for the cake
column7: and then bring it back to the bakery if I wanted writing on the cake.\n\nI paid for the cake
column8:
walked back to the bakery department and asked the same lady if I can get "Happy Birthday Ricky" written on the cake. She seemed like she did not want to be bothered.

She stuck a small sign in the cake that said "Happy Birthday" and sloppily wrote the name (see picture attached). I could have have stuck a happy birthday sign in the cake myself.

DO NOT GO TO THIS SHOPRITE FOR ANY BAKED GOODS. I also saw a lot cakes that were expired still out for sale.'

author: Marilyn Rotondella
text: 'This is the 1st time in years
column5: I have not had to wait 40 mins on the deli
column6: they NEVER have enough people working in the deli
column7: and the lines are too long'

author: Casey Donohue
text: 'Regular routine shopping experience :) great selection and liquor store in the back.'

author: Irving Almonte
text: 'Clean supermarket'

author: Serena Robles
text: "I would give this store 0 stars if I could. The majority of the check-outs have been converted to self check-outs resulting in a mad dash to scan and then bag your groceries at the same time
column5: which is particularly difficult if you're shopping alone. What I'm sure was intended to maximize efficiencies has actually made the check-out process more of a nuisance with long lines and lack luster service."

author: Amir Zeenreich
text: 'Our go to for local groceries\nAlways clean
column5: good variety and reasonably priced'

author: Cindy Joseph
text: 'Clean...well organized'

author: Brian
text: "Hoboken Shop Rite is doing its part in helping spread the virus. While other grocers are enforcing mask rules and distancing (Trader Joes) Shop Rite lets employees flout the rules.  I've seen employees
column5: especially stocking clerks
column6: with masks around their neck and brushing within a foot of shoppers - not caring at all.  Shameful!"

author: Steven Otero
text: 'Very clean and very fast service'

author: Kevin Carter
text: "Huge with adequate parking. They didn't have the Shady Brooks farm precooked turkey meatballs. But I'll try the MamaMancini ones."

author: Bernadette Jones
text: 'Every cashier was very good impolite'

author: Romeo Carrion
text: 'Store was well stocked'

author: JcLatina
text: 'Happy everything was setup with hand sanizter but
column5: to many in the place am afraid to say.'

author: Edwin
text: 'Love it
column5: the staff was very helpful and I was able to find the few things that I need. Definitely will come back to shop.'

author: David Reagan
text: "It's the best store around Hoboken. Biggest selection and definitely the best prices. However
column5: other places are better for certain things."
